title: Nike Delays Launch of Travis Scott Sneaker After Astroworld Festival Deaths; Houston Police Department is investigating the rapper's concert, where a crowd surge this month killed 10 and injured dozens
text:
Nike wasn't immediately available for additional comment.

Representatives for Mr. Scott didn't immediately respond to a request for comment about the Nike announcement. Nike and Mr. Scott have previously collaborated on sneakers and clothing.

The move by Nike comes as the Houston Police Department has launched a criminal investigation of the Astroworld Festival. Causes of deaths for the deceased are pending.

Earlier this week, a 9-year-old boy who was on life support after being trampled was pronounced dead, the 10th and latest death resulting from the crowd surge.

Mr. Scott has been named in several lawsuits along with others involved in organizing the show, including Live Nation Entertainment Inc., the world's largest concert-promotion company and owner of the Astroworld Festival's promoter.

Mr. Scott's lawyers have said the rapper didn't know what was happening in the crowd of more than 50,000 fans at his show. While it appeared as if Mr. Scott performed a full set, "when he was told to stop, he stoppedâ€”and it was an abbreviated set," said David Byrnes, one of Mr. Scott's lawyers.

Mr. Scott learned of the police's declaration of a mass casualty incident and the deaths early the next morning, his lawyers have said.

Write to Talal Ansari at talal.ansari@wsj.com

Nike Delays Launch of Travis Scott Sneaker After Astroworld Festival Deaths
